question.text:
Which of the following is true regarding the given electron transport chain?
C o Q → Cyt c → Cyt aa 3 → O 2

options.text: <math> <mrow> <mtext>CoQ</mtext> <mo> → </mo> <mtext>Cyt c </mtext> </mrow> </math>is H<sup>+</sup> yielding site and <math> <mrow> <msub> <mtext>aa</mtext> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <mo>→</mo> <msub> <mtext>O</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> </math> is H<sup>+</sup> absorbing site
No H<sup>+</sup> is absorbed or released

solution.text: In electron transport chain electrons transport through a series of carriers.  H<sup>+</sup> of NADH<sup>+  </sup>(received from krebs cycle) is accepted by FAD as a result of which FAD is reduced to FADH<sup>+</sup> and NADH<sup>+</sup> is oxidised to NAD. Reduced FADH<sup>+</sup> is oxidised by CoQ, with the formation of CoQH<sup>+ </sup>. H<sup>+</sup> ions then move to Cyt b, then Cyt c, Cyt a and Cyt <math> <mrow> <msub> <mtext>aa</mtext> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <mspace></mspace></mrow></math>. Ultimately these H<sup>+</sup> are accepted by O<sub>2</sub> and H<sub>2</sub>O is formed.
